4- Development of non-broadcast uses of radlo-TV in
education,
NAEB will assume responsibility for all services (except
programs) for closed circuit uses; will maintain liason with
other organizations involved in audio-visual developments and
keep educational broadcasting informed of important developments
in related fields.
5. Information Services
NAEB will be responsible for: collection and publication of
research, establish a national clearing house and referral center
for inquiries re radio-TV education; and publish a Washington Report,
FACTSHEET (similar to old JCET one), and its regular Newsletter
and Journal, and a directory of educational radio stations.
Center will publish: directory of ETV stations (formerly
issued by JCET), itâ€™s regular NET News, Inside Channels, and NET
Annual Reports,and special reports on matters concerning NET-
station relations.
|The following matters are not JCET related but concern
long-range relationships of NAEB-NETRC.)
6. International Educational Broadcasting
NAEB will have primary responsibility for international
excahnge of consultants and scholars, visits, or missions by
educational broadcasters, and all international affairs not directly
related to program planning, production, or distribution.
NETRC will have primary responsibility for international
program related activities.
7. Supporting Services
